item.title: Model-based optimization of vaccine inoculum dose
item.description: We described some of our past and ongoing work in using a combination of models and data to understand the role of inoculum dose on vaccination and infection outcomes. The presentation slides (as pdf) are here.

item.title: Introduction to within-host modeling
item.description:
Preparation

  • Install R and (optional) Rstudio.
  • Install the DSAIRM R package and take a brief look. This website provides instructions.

Outline

I cover the following topics in this workshop (my co-teacher Paul Thomas covers the immunology part):

  1. Introduction to modeling
  2. Some example models
  3. How to use simulation models
  4. Sources of uncertainty
  5. Types of models
  6. How to build (good) models
  7. How to assess modeling studies

Presentation Slides

All pdf slides as zip file

item.title: Introduction to Infectious Disease Modeling
item.description:
Preparation

  • Install R and (optional) Rstudio.
  • Install the DSAIDE R package and take a brief look. This website provides instructions.
  • Optional: Read this paper which provides background reading for the “ID Control of multiple outbreaks” app in DSAIDE.

Outline

The following topics are covered in this workshop:

  1. Introduction to infectious disease modeling
  2. Some example models
  3. How to use simulation models
  4. Types of models
  5. Sources of uncertainty
  6. How to build (good) models
  7. How to assess modeling studies
  8. Active learning of infectious disease epidemiology

Presentation Slides

All pdf slides as zip file
